page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Before Arborfield Garrison was built the land was part of Bearwood Estate,which was owned by Mr Walters.In 1904 the army decided to build a Remount depot at Arborfield Cross where they could trainand look after many horses. There were many farms in the area. Namely,New and Old Biggs farm,Whitehall Farm.Ellis farm,Langly Common Farm and Highlands. The Remount Depot was closed in 1937 because horses weren't used so much. In 1937 the army started to build garrison to house two royal artillery regiments. But the war broke out and the regiments never arrived. In 1942 REME was formed. (Royal Eletrical and Mechanical Engineers).
